## Detailed Checklist

### Step 1: Assessment & Planning
**Description:** Analyze current codebase, identify dependencies, and plan migration strategy.

| Task                       | Status         | Assigned To         | Time Spent | Notes                                                                 |
|----------------------------|----------------|---------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Document current architecture | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |
| List all dependencies      | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |
| Identify critical components | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |

---

### Step 2: Setup Target Environment
**Description:** Setup development environment for target language/framework.

| Task                       | Status         | Assigned To         | Time Spent | Notes                                                                 |
|----------------------------|----------------|---------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Install language/framework | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |
| Setup project structure    | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |
| Configure build tools      | üî¥ Not Started |                     |            |                                                                       |

---

---

### Step 5: API/Interface Migration

---

## Code Review Checklist
- [ ] Code adheres to Java coding standards.  
- [ ] All critical logic has been documented and reviewed.  
- [ ] Unit tests are comprehensive and pass successfully.  
- [ ] No hardcoded values; configurations use external files.  
- [ ] Code has been peer-reviewed by at least two developers.
